snippet: A vague Chinese regulation allows insurance companies to make overseas investments of less than 15 percent of their assets, but it has wiggle room.
abstract: Obscure rule in China's insurance regulations deepens mystery swirling around Chinese insurer Anbang Insurance Group's decision to drop its $14 billion bid for Starwood Hotels & Resorts; phrase mentioned in rules permits overseas investments, but does not indicate how to valuate them.

byline.contributor: Leslie Picker contributed reporting from New York.

lead_paragraph: A vague Chinese regulation allows insurance companies to make overseas investments of less than 15 percent of their assets, but it has wiggle room.

headline.main: Chinese Phrase Adds Mystery to Anbang’s About-Face on Starwood
headline.print_headline: Enigmatic Rule Adds to the Mystery Shrouding Anbang’s Starwood Reversal
